socratic_questions:
1. What is the relationship between the value of $\arcsin \frac{5}{13}$ and the angle in the right triangle?
2. Which sides of the right triangle are involved in calculating the value of $\cos \left( \arcsin \frac{5}{13} \right)$?
3. How can we determine the length of the adjacent side in the right triangle?
4. Can we use any trigonometric identity to relate $\cos \left( \arcsin \frac{5}{13} \right)$ to other trigonometric ratios?
5. How does the value of $\cos \left( \arcsin \frac{5}{13} \right)$ compare to the value of $\frac{12}{13}$?
6. Are there other right triangles with similar angles where we can apply a similar thought process to find the value of $\cos \left( \arcsin \frac{5}{13} \right)$?
7. How does this problem relate to the concept of inverse trigonometric functions and their application in solving trigonometric equations?
